{"step_by_step_thinking": "Autoimmune disorders are conditions in which the body's immune system attacks its own cells. Ulcerative colitis is an inflammatory bowel disease that causes long-lasting inflammation and ulcers in your digestive tract, and it is considered an autoimmune disorder. Grave's disease is an autoimmune disorder that results in the overproduction of thyroid hormones. Rheumatoid arthritis is a chronic inflammatory disorder affecting many joints, including those in the hands and feet, and it is also an autoimmune disorder. SLE, or systemic lupus erythematosus, is a chronic autoimmune disease that can affect any part of the body, so it is also an autoimmune disorder.", "answer_choice": "None of the above"}
